dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 383 IH: No Tax Dollars for the United Nations’ Climate Agenda Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Luetkemeyer (for himself, Mrs. Black, Mr. Duncan of South Carolina, Mr. Duncan of Tennessee, Mr. Graves of Missouri, Mr. Long, Mr. McKinley, Mr. Sensenbrenner, and Mr. Bridenstine) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To prohibit United States contributions to the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change, the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change, and the Green Climate Fund.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the No Tax Dollars for the United Nations’ Climate Agenda Act.

section.header: Prohibition on United States contributions to the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change, the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change, and the Green Climate Fund

subsection.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, no funds made available to any Federal department or agency may be used to make assessed or voluntary contributions on behalf of the United States to or for the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC), the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC), or the Green Climate Fund.
The prohibition on use of funds contained in subsection (a) applies with respect to funds made available for fiscal year 2016 and subsequent fiscal years.
